title: Authors and Citation
text: Jadey Ryan. Author, maintainer. Molly McIlquham. Author. Dani Gelardi. Author. Washington State Department Agriculture. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ryan J, McIlquham M, Gelardi D (2025). washi: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding. R package version 0.2.1, https://github.com/WA-Department--Agriculture/washi.
code: @Manual{,   title = {washi: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding},   author = {Jadey Ryan and Molly McIlquham and Dani Gelardi},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.1},   url = {https://github.com/WA-Department-of-Agriculture/washi}, }

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: Inspired branding R packages glitr, ratlas, nmfspalette, washi provides color palettes themes consistent Washington Soil Health Initiative (WaSHI) branding. package used direct collaborators within WaSHI, though welcome adapt package suit organization’s branding. Learn functions available use function reference webpage. help within RStudio, place cursor within function name press <F1> open help page <F2> open function source code.

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: Install washi CRAN : , can install development version washi r-universe : load package :
code: install.packages("washi") install.packages('washi',                   repos = c(                    'https://wa-department-of-agriculture.r-universe.dev',                    'https://cloud.r-project.org')                  ) library("washi")

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: washi uses Poppins Lato fonts ragg systemfonts packages. can install fonts computer :   make fonts available RStudio, set Graphics backend use AGG RStudio options dialog box.  make fonts available knitting RMarkdown Quarto, use following chunk setting: Learn ragg package documentation custom fonts June Choe’s blog post.
code: # install.packages("ragg") # install.packages("systemfonts") washi_install_fonts() #> ℹ To install the fonts on Windows: #> • Select all .ttf files in the newly opened directory. #> • Right-click + Install. #> • Restart RStudio. knitr::opts_chunk$set(dev = "ragg_png")

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: list names available palettes, call names(washi_pal). view palette, use washi_pal_view() function.

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: palette primarily access individual brand colors fonts, table headers, graphic backgrounds, etc. colors, used together plots, accessible may color blindness. Individual colors can accessed washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]].
code: washi_pal_view("standard")

what: WaSHI colors adjusted to be more color-blind friendly
title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
code: washi_pal_view("color_blind")

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: Available green, blue, red, gold.
code: washi_pal_view("green_gradient", n = 4, reverse = TRUE)

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: washi provides example dataset, subset anonymized WaSHI State Soils Assessment. dataset comes long, tidy form one measurement per row; wide form one sample per row. purpose provide example soils dataset use plots tables.

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: washi provides ggplot2 scale theme functions apply WaSHI colors, fonts, styling.

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
code: library(ggplot2)  # 1. Prepare data example_data_long |>   subset(measurement %in% c("total_c_percent", "poxc_mg_kg") &     !texture == "Loamy Sand") |>   # 2. Pipe to ggplot()   ggplot(aes(x = value, fill = texture, color = texture)) +   labs(     title = "Distribution of POXC (mg/kg) and Total C (%)",     subtitle = "Example with geom_density() and facet_wrap().",        ) +   geom_density(alpha = 0.4) +   facet_wrap(. ~ measurement, scales = "free") +   # 3. Add washi_theme() with argument to change legend position   washi_theme(legend_position = "bottom") +   # 4. Add washi_scale()   washi_scale() +   # 5. Tweak for your specific plot   xlab(NULL) +   guides(col = guide_legend(nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE))

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
code: # Single geom_point plot example_data_wide |>   subset(crop %in% c("Apple", "Cherry", "Potato")) |>   ggplot(aes(x = ph, y = mn_mg_kg, color = crop)) +   labs(     title = "Scatter plot of pH and Mn (mg/kg)",     subtitle = "Example with geom_point().",     caption = "This is a caption."   ) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   washi_theme() +   washi_scale()

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
code: example_data_wide |>   ggplot(aes(x = forcats::fct_rev(forcats::fct_infreq(crop)))) +   geom_bar(fill = washi_pal[["standard"]][["blue"]]) +   geom_text(     aes(       y = after_stat(count),       label = after_stat(count)     ),     stat = "count",     hjust = 2.5,     color = "white"   ) +   # Flip coordinates to accomodate long crop names   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "Number of samples in each crop",     subtitle = "Example plot with geom_bar() without gridlines.",     y = NULL,     x = NULL   ) +   # Turn gridlines off   washi_theme(gridline_y = FALSE, gridline_x = FALSE) +   # Remove x-axis   theme(axis.text.x = element_blank())

title: Washington Soil Health Initiative Branding
text: washi provides function create flextable WaSHI colors, fonts, styling.
code: ft <- example_data_wide |>   head(5) |>   subset(select = c(     "sample_id",     "crop",     "total_n_percent",     "total_c_percent"   )) |>   washi_flextable(cols_bold = 1)

what: Example data in long (tidy) format — example_data_long
title: Example data in long (tidy) format — example_data_long
text: subset WaSHI State Soils Assessment dataset anonymized. dataset tidied, measurement row.

title: Example data in long (tidy) format — example_data_long
code: example_data_long

what: example_data_long A data frame with 1,800 rows and 14 columns:
title: Example data in long (tidy) format — example_data_long
text: year Year sample sample_id, producer_id, field_id Anonymized IDs farm_name, producer_name, field_name Anonymized names longitude, latitude Truncated coordinates texture Measured soil texture measurement Measurement name units value Measurement result

title: Example data in long (tidy) format — example_data_long
text: https://agr.wa.gov/departments/land--water/natural-resources/soil-health/state---soils

what: Example data in wide format — example_data_wide
title: Example data in wide format — example_data_wide
text: subset WaSHI State Soils Assessment dataset anonymized. dataset presents sample row, columns measurement.

title: Example data in wide format — example_data_wide
code: example_data_wide

what: example_data_wide A data frame with 30 rows and 72
title: Example data in wide format — example_data_wide
text: columns: year Year sample sample_id, producer_id, field_id Anonymized IDs farm_name, producer_name, field_name Anonymized names longitude, latitude Truncated coordinates texture Measured soil texture columns Column name includes measurement units; value measurement results

title: Example data in wide format — example_data_wide
text: https://agr.wa.gov/departments/land--water/natural-resources/soil-health/state---soils

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
text: Creates flextable WaSHI's style.

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
code: washi_flextable(   data,   cols_bold = NULL,   header_font = "Lato",   body_font = "Poppins",   header_font_color = "white",   header_bg_color = washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]],   border_color = washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]] )

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
text: data Dataframe table. cols_bold Numeric indices columns bold. Defaults NULL. header_font Font family header text. Defaults "Lato". body_font Font family table body text. Defaults "Poppins". header_font_color Hexcode color header font. Defaults white. header_bg_color Hexcode color header background. Defaults WaSHI green. border_color Hexcode color horizontal borders. Defaults WaSHI tan.

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
text: flextable formatted WaSHI's style.

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
text: sample_id county crop total_n_percent total_c_percent D030301 D Wheat 0.08 0.67 D030302 D CRP/Conservation 0.09 0.94 D040401 D Apple 0.09 0.87 D040402 D Green Manure 0.10 1.12 D040403 D Cherry 0.09 0.86 D040404 D Green Manure 0.13 1.56 B010101 B Hops 0.10 1.01 B010102 B Hops 0.11 0.94 B010103 B Hops 0.11 1.08 B010104 B Hops 0.11 1.06 B010105 B Hops 0.09 0.83 B010106 B Hops 0.10 0.90 F050501 F Potato 0.03 0.38 F050502 F Potato 0.06 0.63 F050503 F Potato 0.05 0.51 B020201 B Potato 0.05 0.48 B020202 B Potato 0.05 0.56 B020203 B Potato 0.08 0.65 W101001 W Bean, Garbanzo 0.15 2.04 W101002 W Bean, Garbanzo 0.15 2.32 W080801 W Bean, Garbanzo 0.15 2.04 W080802 W Pea 0.15 2.08 W090901 W Bean, Garbanzo 0.11 1.37 W090902 W Bean, Garbanzo 0.14 1.92 O060601 O Apple 0.16 2.12 O060602 O Apple 0.18 2.44 O070701 O Apple 0.16 2.17 O070702 O Apple 0.14 1.59 Y111101 Y Apple 0.09 0.88 Y111102 Y Apple 0.12 1.33
code: subset(   example_data_wide,   select = c(     "sample_id",     "county",     "crop",     "total_n_percent",     "total_c_percent"   ) ) |>   washi_flextable(cols_bold = 1) #> Couldn't find 'sans'. what: Install Lato and Poppins fonts on your system — washi_install_fonts
title: Install Lato and Poppins fonts on your system — washi_install_fonts
text: Opens font files install computer.

title: Install Lato and Poppins fonts on your system — washi_install_fonts
code: washi_install_fonts()

title: Install Lato and Poppins fonts on your system — washi_install_fonts
text: Opens directory containing font files.

title: WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
text: Color palettes stored named list.

title: WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
code: washi_pal

title: WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
text: object class list length 11.

title: WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
text: List available washi color palettes

title: WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
code: # List names of available palettes names(washi_pal) #>  [1] "standard"        "color_blind"     "accent"          "green_highlight" #>  [5] "blue_highlight"  "red_highlight"   "gold_highlight"  "green_gradient"  #>  [9] "blue_gradient"   "red_gradient"    "gold_gradient"    # Get hex codes from a palette using dollar `$name` or # double bracket # `[["name"]]` operators for extracting list elements washi_pal$standard #>     green      blue       red      gold      gray    ltgray       tan     cream  #> "#023b2c" "#335c67" "#a60f2d" "#fcb040" "#3e3d3d" "#7C7979" "#ccc29c" "#F2F0E6"   washi_pal[["green_gradient"]] #> [1] "#023B2C" "#1C4F40" "#376355" "#51776A" "#6C8B7E" "#879F93" "#A2B3A8" #> [8] "#BCC7BC"  # Extract a color from the standard WaSHI palette washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]] #> [1] "#023b2c"

title: Setup a color palette — washi_pal_setup
text: Choose desired number colors whether colors reversed.

title: Setup a color palette — washi_pal_setup
code: washi_pal_setup(palette = "standard", n, reverse = FALSE)

title: Setup a color palette — washi_pal_setup
text: palette Character name palette washi_pal. See names(washi_pal) list available palettes. n Number colors palette. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE.

title: Setup a color palette — washi_pal_setup
text: vector color hex codes.

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
text: Show colors within palette plot.

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
code: washi_pal_view(palette = "color_blind", n, reverse = FALSE)

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
text: palette Character name palette washi_pal. See names(washi_pal) list available palettes. n Number colors palette. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE.

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
text: plot color displayed.

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
code: washi_pal_view("standard")   washi_pal_view("color_blind")   washi_pal_view("blue_gradient", 4, reverse = TRUE)

what: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
text: Provides compatibility ggplot2.

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
code: washi_scale(   palette = "color_blind",   aesthetics = c("color", "fill"),   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE,   discrete = TRUE,   ... )

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
text: palette Character name palette washi_pal. See names(washi_pal) list available palettes. aesthetics Character string vector character strings listing name(s) aesthetic(s) scale works . Defaults c("color", "fill"), applies palette color fill aesthetics time. alpha Numeric transparency level color 0 1. Default 1 (transparent). reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE. discrete Boolean indicating whether color aesthetic discrete . Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed discrete_scale() scale_color_gradientn(), used respectively discrete TRUE FALSE

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
text: ScaleContinuous ScaleDiscrete object can added ggplot object.

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
code: library(ggplot2)  # Discrete scale example_data_wide |>   subset(crop %in% c("Apple", "Cherry", "Potato")) |>   ggplot(aes(x = ph, y = mn_mg_kg, color = crop)) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   theme_minimal() +   washi_scale()   # Continuous scale example_data_wide |>   ggplot(aes(x = total_c_percent, y = poxc_mg_kg, color = poxc_mg_kg)) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   theme_minimal() +   washi_scale("green_gradient", reverse = TRUE, discrete = FALSE)

title: Create standard WaSHI plots — washi_theme
text: changed defaults function can overridden another call ggplot2::theme() desired changes.

title: Create standard WaSHI plots — washi_theme
code: washi_theme(   header_font = "Lato Black",   header_color = "#151414",   body_font = "Poppins",   body_color = "#151414",   text_scale = 1,   legend_position = "top",   facet_space = 2,   color_gridline = washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]],   gridline_y = TRUE,   gridline_x = TRUE,   ... )

title: Create standard WaSHI plots — washi_theme
text: Adapted glitr::si_style().

title: Create standard WaSHI plots — washi_theme
text: header_font Font family title subtitle. Defaults "Lato Black". header_color Font color title subtitle. Defaults almost black. body_font Font family text Defaults "Poppins". body_color Font color text Defaults almost black. text_scale Scalar grow/shrink text defined within. legend_position Position legend ("none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top", two-element numeric vector). Defaults "top". facet_space Controls far apart facets . color_gridline Gridline color. Defaults WaSHI tan. gridline_y Boolean indicating whether major gridlines displayed y axis. Default TRUE. gridline_x Boolean indicating whether major gridlines displayed x axis. Default TRUE. ... Pass parameters theme already defined within.

title: Create standard WaSHI plots — washi_theme
text: ggplot2 object

title: Create standard WaSHI plots — washi_theme
code: library(ggplot2) # NOTE: These examples do not use Poppins or Lato in order to pass # automated checks on computers without these fonts installed.  # Single geom_point plot example_data_wide |>   subset(crop %in% c("Apple", "Cherry", "Potato")) |>   ggplot(aes(x = ph, y = mn_mg_kg, color = crop)) +   labs(     title = "Scatter plot of pH and Mn (mg/kg)",     subtitle = "Example with geom_point().",     caption = "This is a caption."   ) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   washi_theme(     header_font = "sans",     body_font = "sans"   ) +   washi_scale()   # Bar plot if (requireNamespace("forcats")) {   example_data_wide |>     ggplot(aes(x = forcats::fct_rev(forcats::fct_infreq(crop)))) +     geom_bar(fill = washi_pal[["standard"]][["blue"]]) +     geom_text(       aes(         y = after_stat(count),         label = after_stat(count)       ),       stat = "count",       hjust = 2.5,       color = "white"     ) +     # Flip coordinates to accommodate long crop names     coord_flip() +     labs(       title = "Number of samples in each crop",       subtitle = "Example plot with geom_bar() without gridlines.",       y = NULL,       x = NULL     ) +     # Turn gridlines off     washi_theme(       gridline_y = FALSE,       gridline_x = FALSE,       header_font = "sans",       body_font = "sans"     ) +     # Remove x-axis     theme(axis.text.x = element_blank()) }   # Facetted geom_density plots example_data_long |>   subset(measurement %in% c("total_c_percent", "poxc_mg_kg") &     !texture == "Loamy Sand") |>   ggplot(aes(x = value, fill = texture, color = texture)) +   labs(     title = "Distribution of POXC (mg/kg) and Total C (%)",     subtitle = "Example with geom_density() and facet_wrap()."   ) +   geom_density(alpha = 0.4) +   facet_wrap(. ~ measurement, scales = "free") +   washi_theme(     legend_position = "bottom",     header_font = "sans",     body_font = "sans"   ) +   washi_scale() +   xlab(NULL) +   guides(col = guide_legend(nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE))

title: washi 0.2.1
text: Fix unit test {ggplot2} v4 update Use snake_case column names example data examples

title: washi 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-09-07 Fonts made available {ragg} {systemfonts} instead {extrafont}. washi_flextable() washi_theme(), default font set “sans” provided font found systemfonts::system_fonts()$family.
